ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This course is one of the single most enriching classes you can take as a Yale College student. Students get to work in a professional capacity and learn about Baroque performance practice, Italian Renaissance rhetoric, and acting theory.
How to sing and appreciate 17th century opera
Performing an opera. Expression on the stage and through music, what it means to create a character, how to be a part of a semi-professional production.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: YBOP is one of the most enriching musical experiences I have ever had at Yale College. The community that Professors Herreid and Dorfman build is supportive, intellectually rigorous, and outright fun. One weakness this year: while a theatrically fulfilling experience, the stage management for this production was at best condescending, at worst demeaning, and on every level unprofessional. The great thing about YBOP, however, is that everyone is incredibly caring and works to make sure that everyone feels well supported and that their needs are met.
First half of the semester is slow and not very useful

This course is unique; before spring break we talk about acting and do some exercises while learning our music, and after spring break, we have rehearsals multiple times a week to create an opera. Because of this, the culmination of this class is incredibly satisfying; a performance is much more gratifying than a test or essay. This class could maybe be improved with a little extra rehearsal of the music before break.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would certainly recommend this course to anyone at Yale with an interest in music or theater. YBOP has been one of the most fulfilling experiences I have ever had as Yale.
I would, if that student wants to be in an opera. This course is a great way to be a part of an operatic production, and is even a great first opera for someone who has never been in one before.
